meanings.definition: To form a pond or small body of water.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the water ponded in the low area.
meanings.sent2: The children ponded water in the backyard to make a small pool.
meanings.sent3: The ducks were delighted when the rain ponded in their favorite spot.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood ponded in her mind like still water.
meanings.sent5: The sun ponded on the surface of the calm pond, creating a beautiful reflection.

meanings.definition: Accumulated in a body of water, as sediment.
meanings.sent1: The ponded sediment created a muddy bottom.
meanings.sent2: The ponded water was murky from all the sediment.
meanings.sent3: The fish swam lazily through the ponded area, stirring up the sediment.
meanings.sent4: The ponded sediment settled at the bottom like a heavy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The ponded sediment made the water look dirty and uninviting.

meanings.definition: To collect or gather in a pond.
meanings.sent1: The leaves ponded in the corner of the pond.
meanings.sent2: She ponded all the fallen petals in the water feature.
meanings.sent3: The frogs ponded around the edge of the pond, enjoying the warmth.
meanings.sent4: The memories ponded in her mind, creating a peaceful scene.
meanings.sent5: The rain ponded in the pond, filling it to the brim.
